1.text: Ball up a handful of newspapers, then stick them inside your shoes.

2.text: Reach for the baking soda if your shoes won’t dry on their own.

3.text: Find a sunny spot outside or put your shoes near a heater.

4.text: Grab 2 dryer sheets and ball them up in your hands.

5.text: Grab some normal table salt and sprinkle a thin layer into each shoe.

6.text: Dab a little bit of rubbing alcohol onto a few cotton pads or cotton balls.

7.text: Mix up a 1:1 ratio of water and white vinegar.

8.text: Remove the insoles from your stinky running shoes or sneakers.

9.text: Use the spray or powder to kill fungus.

10.text: Throw away your old, smelly insoles and replace them with deodorizing ones.

11.text: Check the tag on your shoes to make sure they’re machine washable.
